meanings.definition: The ability to retain or remember information.
meanings.sent1: Her retentivity in class helps her ace all her exams.
meanings.sent2: The retentivity of the computer's memory is impressive.
meanings.sent3: The retentivity of his brain is like a superpower during exams.
meanings.sent4: His retentivity is a treasure trove of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The retentivity of the sponge soaking up water is similar to how our brains absorb information.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to hold onto or retain something.
meanings.sent1: The retentivity of the glue kept the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The retentivity of the magnet was strong enough to hold multiple paper clips.
meanings.sent3: The retentivity of the backpack's zipper was put to the test with all the books inside.
meanings.sent4: The retentivity of the soil allowed the plant to grow strong roots.
meanings.sent5: The retentivity of the container kept the freshness of the food intact.
